I drift along the gray tides—the conflicting space between muted black and blaring white, where nuance lives and extremes subside.

BACK OF ID

ABOUT TYNE

Hello! I'm Tyne, an IT student at USTP - CDO, Philippines. My area of focus includes project management, writing (both literary and academic), graphic design, UI/UX design, tech solutions ideation, and anything art-related. I also enjoy exploring trends and other cool tech-related stuff. In my creations, I try to find balance between creativity and structure.

My profound love for arts and tech extends to my personal belief that these two are simply our ways of understanding and sustaining the human experience. We create things to satisfy the hows and whys and fill in our need to consume, but we also create to make meaning, to leave traces of ourselves behind.

As a young adult and a woman who is still blooming and striving in a stereotypically male-dominated field, I advocate for inclusivity in this domain. Whatever age, gender, or even pronouns you identify yourself, you can definitely shine and have a spot in the industry as long as you believe in yourself and what you're capable of. As a Gen-Z also, I strongly encourage progressive use of modern solutions like AI.

In the still moments, one may find me sketching out feelings, drafting pieces of my soul into journals and poems, or immersing myself in the comfort of stories—through pop culture, fan works, or quiet reflection.
